title: (x) KFC logo - custom (similar to Friz Quadrata) {Adriano S}
content:
Can anyone tell me what this font is?? ![kentucy fried chichen LOGO](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203815im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26972.gif)

 [‹ (x) Pointing hand dingbats - various {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203815/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3222 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Cowboy Poetry - HTF Hoefler Text {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203815/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3236 "Go to next forum topic")
author: webbetty

comments.content: It bears some similarity to Friz Quadrata, but I think this might be custom.

I guess indeed [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203815/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/friz-quadrata/bold-italic/testdrive.html?s=KFC&p=72) is about the closest you'll get   
using an existing typeface. Logos of big companies   
usually are custom designed, Michelle. It prevents   
misappropriation and lends the logo its uniqueness.   
   
If you stretch the characters a bit and insert the   
inline yourself you can approximate the logo.
